intro: Steviopsis fendleri, commonly known as the Mexican verbena, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers range in color from white to purple. Steviopsis fendleri is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
